title: The Long, Slow Vanish Of Britain's Illustrious Recording Clubs
teaser: In the years following World War II, tape-recording clubs gathered significant popularity in the UK. Clubs met to share tapes of everything from bird calls to the sounds of local events. Today, though, only a few such clubs still survive.
